articles.headline: Attacks Escalate as Palestinians Fight for Power
articles.snippet: Hamas and Fatah sharply escalated their fight for supremacy in what is starting to look like a civil war.
articles.abstract: Hamas and Fatah sharply escalated their fight for supremacy in what is starting to look like a civil war.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM, June 12 — Gunmen of rival Palestinian factions Hamas and Fatah sharply escalated their fight for supremacy on Tuesday, with Hamas taking over much of the northern Gaza Strip in what is beginning to look increasingly like a civil war.
articles.byline: By Steven Erlanger and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: Shake-Up in Newsroom of Journal
articles.snippet: The Wall Street Journal announced a major newsroom shake-up, including the reassignment and replacement of several top editors.
articles.abstract: The Wall Street Journal announced a major newsroom shake-up, including the reassignment and replacement of several top editors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Wall Street Journal, already roiled by a proposed takeover by Rupert Murdoch, today announced a major newsroom shake-up, including the reassignment and replacement of several top editors, officials there say.

articles.headline: Iraqis Are Failing to Meet U.S. Benchmarks
articles.snippet: Just three months before progress reports are due, Iraq’s leaders have failed to agree on nearly every key law.
articles.abstract: Just three months before progress reports are due, Iraq’s leaders have failed to agree on nearly every key law.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, June 12 — Iraq’s political leaders have failed to reach agreements on nearly every law that the Americans have demanded as benchmarks, despite heavy pressure from Congress, the White House and top military commanders. With only three months until progress reports are due in Washington, the deadlock has reached a point where many Iraqi and American officials now question whether any substantive laws will pass before the end of the year.

articles.headline: ConAgra’s Chief Is Moving to Revitalize Some Venerable Brands
articles.snippet: Gary M. Rodkin is introducing updated twists on the company’s old portfolio to find new ways to please fickle consumers.
articles.abstract: Gary M. Rodkin is introducing updated twists on the company’s old portfolio to find new ways to please fickle consumers.
articles.lead_paragraph: OMAHA, June 12 — It wasn’t too long ago that the sleek and expansive test kitchens at ConAgra Foods were little more than decoration.

articles.headline: That iPhone Has a Keyboard, but It’s Not Mechanical
articles.snippet: If there is a billion-dollar gamble underlying Apple’s iPhone, it lies in what this smart cellphone does not have: a mechanical keyboard.
articles.abstract: If there is a billion-dollar gamble underlying Apple’s iPhone, it lies in what this smart cellphone does not have: a mechanical keyboard.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 12 — If there is a billion-dollar gamble underlying Apple’s iPhone, it lies in what this smart cellphone does not have: a mechanical keyboard.

articles.headline: Bond Yields Soar, Driving Shares Down
articles.snippet: The cost of borrowing headed higher as yields on the 10-year Treasury note hit a five-year high, climbing to 5.248 percent.
articles.abstract: The cost of borrowing headed higher as yields on the 10-year Treasury note hit a five-year high, climbing to 5.248 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: The cost of borrowing headed higher yesterday and drove the stock market down sharply.

articles.headline: Federal Grant for a Medical Mission Goes Awry
articles.snippet: A case of two Coast Guard cutters shows that earmarks to faith-based groups may not achieve their stated purpose.
articles.abstract: A case of two Coast Guard cutters shows that earmarks to faith-based groups may not achieve their stated purpose.
articles.lead_paragraph: In theory, it was simple: Congress gave two decommissioned Coast Guard cutters to a faith-based group in California, directing that the ships be used only to provide medical services to islands in the Central and South Pacific.
articles.byline: By Diana B. Henriques and Andrew W. Lehren

articles.headline: Las Vegas Caters to Asia’s High Rollers
articles.snippet: Casinos in Las Vegas have become much more aggressive in wooing Asians both domestically and abroad.
articles.abstract: Casinos in Las Vegas have become much more aggressive in wooing Asians both domestically and abroad.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Without the dreamy postcard views of the neon-pulsing Strip, visitors to the V.I.P. lounge at the top of the Venetian hotel and casino here might think they had taken an elevator to someplace in Hong Kong or Shanghai.
